text: ok here's what gets me about cell phone
service you pay two hundred dollars for
what's essentially a six-hundred-dollar
phone the phone company is subsidizing
you over two years you're going to pay
off the rest okay fine but the thing is
once you're done repaying the phone
shouldn't your monthly bill drop at that
point huh huh and what about that
two-year contract anyway with any other
industry if you're tired of a certain
company you can quit it lawn mowing
service or cable TV or babysitting or
magazine subscriptions what makes the
cell phone carrier so special well
here's the good news t-mobile agrees
with me from now on there are no annual
contract to t-mobile and as for paying
for the phone you can either pay the
full price on the first day or you can
pay it off twenty dollars a month
doesn't matter the point is once it's
paid off your monthly bill drops as it
should be and by the way the service
costs a lot less than the other
companies I know who cares about
t-mobile there in last place except
they're finally spending four billion
dollars to build a 4G LTE network if
they ever become a contender I hope the
executives at AT&T Verizon and Sprint
lose a lot of sleep they should from a
guilty conscience
